channel.title: Neta on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Neta on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Python description of a parent killed literally
item.description: @Raclett3's Python programming whose parents were killed by literals of strings, numbers and truth values I think it’s very interesting :raised_hands:, but at the same time I couldn’t understand what was happening, so I looked into it. It’s a commentary or my own study. I mainly write “small numerical values”. If you make a mistake, throw Masakari. #0 int() # 0 This is as per @Raclett3’s link. or return 0 if no arguments are given

item.title: [Python] Theme: Standard output [Difficulty ★★★★★]
item.description: Please output `Sh1ma` on standard output. The rules are as follows. Do not include strings ("", '') in the code Do not include numbers in the code Prohibition of chr and ord If you can, please.
